Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Who are you faxing so early in the morning?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, umm... kinda hard to explain.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I don't have a ton of contact with the Scranton branch, but, before I left, I took a box of Dwight's stationery, so, from time to time, I send Dwight faxes. From himself. From the future. [reading fax] "Dwight, at 8 A.M. today, someone poisons the coffee. Do not drink the coffee. More instructions will follow. Cordially, Future Dwight."

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No![knocks coffee out of Stanley's hand.] You'll thank me later.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: There she is - Jan Levinson. First...

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: ...thing in the morning. Love to start my morning with a hearty bowl of Jan.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [singing] Just call me Levinson in the morning, baby.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: I am here to tell you that we are closing the Scranton branch.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't understand.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: The board voted last night to close your branch.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: On whom's authority?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: The board's.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: I'm very sorry. I don't relish telling you this. You've been a big part of this company, and the board asked me to thank you for your years of service.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You're welcome.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: A small number of people will be transferred to the Stamford branch, and the rest will be getting severance packages.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Am I a small number person or a severance package person?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Well, we haven't made final decisions about personnel yet. But you're a severance package person.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh... [burrys head in hands] Oh, my god. Oh, my god! I don't really get it 'cause we're not doing that bad and our numbers are gonna come up.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Well, it's not all about numbers, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well...

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: It's... it's about talent.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, you gotta be... Josh?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Our CFO believes that Josh is going to play an important role in our company's future.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh really, what role is that? King of the stupid universe?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It is an outrage, that's all. It's... hey're making a huge, huge mistake. Let's see Josh replace these people. Let's see Josh find another Stanley. You think Stanleys grow on trees? Well they don't. There is no Stanley tree. Do you think the world is crawling with Phyllises? Show me that farm. With Phyllises and Kevins sprouting up all over the place. Ripe for the plucking. Show me that farm.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Pictures. Memories. [Picks up a framed photo of Stanley's daughter from Stanley's desk] Look at that. They grow up so fast.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hey stranger.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Don't say that. That just sounds weird. Please.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Sorry. I just feel like we haven't talked in awhile.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well... we have nothin to talk about, Dwight. Just do your work ... while you still can.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: When you become close with someone, you develop a kind of sixth sense. You can read their moods like a book. And right now, the title of Michael's book is, "Something Weird is Going On." Colon, "What Did Jan Say? The Michael Scott Story. By Michael Scott, with Dwight Schrute."

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Hey, um... did you hear about your friends in Pennsylvania? Rumor has it that the Scranton Branch is... [clicks her tongue to her mouth motions chopping off a head]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Really? Wow... that's bad.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Um, sorry... the Scranton branch is closing? [Karen nods and Andy looks at Jim] In your face!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, I work here now.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Mmmm.. suck-ah!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Are you okay?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, great! Amazing. Best physical condition of my life.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What did Jan want?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Nothing. Just checking in. I can't tell you, so...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What can't you tell me?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Nothing, Pam.[whispers to himself] What difference does it make? We'll be gone in a couple of weeks anyway.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What?!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You just said that we're gonna be gone...?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Do I have any messages?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Michael, what's going on?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ok, ok...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [facing the whole office] Listen up, everybody... I have some news. We are screwed. Dunder-Mifflin, Scranton is being shut down.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Michael, uh... we shouldn't be talking about this until all the decisions have been made.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You knew about this all along, didn't you?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Jan told me just a few minutes before she told you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Traitor. You are a traitor.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: What about us, Michael? Do we still have jobs?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't know. Probably not. This is the worst.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: It makes perfect sense that it would happen today because I just received this in the mail. [holds up cards] A thousand business cards with this address and phone number.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I don't want to blame anyone in particular. I think everyone's to blame.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: If I get to stay and Ryan is laid off, I will kill myself. Like Romeo and Juliet, the Claire Danes one.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [surrounded by clapping coworkers] Stamford, Connecticut! Stamford, Connecticut!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I worked in Scranton for a really long time. And uh, it's going to be weird that it's all disappearing. I mean, I always knew that the branch would shut down someday. I just figured it would be because Michael sold the building for some magic beans.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I couldn't be happier. I'm gonna take the severance and retire. My wife and I are gonna travel. [chuckles] I really couldn't be happier.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: It's a blessing in disguise. Actually, not even in disguise. Sometimes at home, I answer the phone, "Dunder-Mifflin, this is Pam." So, maybe that'll stop now.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: What does that mean?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Well, some of us are fired and a few are going to Connecticut.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: I don't really want to work here without Pam. You know that Cinderella song, "You Don't Know What You Got (Till It's Gone)"? That pretty much says it better than how I know how to say it... in words.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Hey Mike.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Darryl. Noble Darryl. [sighs]

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Look, I heard about the office. Tough break.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I know, I know. Well, I'll land on my feet. Don't worry about me.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I wasn't.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So, you'll be okay too. You're a warrior. You're smart, capable. You'll find something else and...

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Actually, Bob Vance bought out the warehouse. So he's keeping on the whole crew. So, we good.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Awesome.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: This is my house. The CFO is taking away my house and giving it to Josh. And Josh is giving the garage to Bob Vance.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All right, listen up. Some of you may have heard some rumors about the branch closing. But, I am not going to take this lying down. I have a plan and I am going to save our jobs. So just hang in there. [Looks at Dwight] Let's go.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, good... you're bringing Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes. This might get ugly. I need backup.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What's the plan?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Go to New York, confront the CFO, show him he's making a mistake... save the branch.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Can I drive?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No... way.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Shotgun!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No. There's no one else.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Still.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Thank you very much. [hangs up cell phone] Okay, secretary says Wallace is away for the day and won't be coming back into the office.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, okay. Um...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: But, do not worry. I have his home address right [presses cell phone button] here.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Why?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Christmas card list.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You sent him cards? You never met him.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: But when I do, we'll have something to talk about.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey, do you have a second?

Quote.Speaker: Josh
Quote.Text: Sure, what's up?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I know it's not definite or whatever, but uh, do you know who's coming over here from Scranton?

Quote.Speaker: Josh
Quote.Text: I honestly don't. I don't know.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay, so is it like sales or... accountants?

Quote.Speaker: Josh
Quote.Text: You know what, Jim, I wouldn't worry about it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What does that mean?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Hi.

Quote.Speaker: Josh
Quote.Text: Jan, hey.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Oh, good. You're both here. Ready to talk logistics?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: [to Kelly] I just feel like it could have been something special if we could have kept working together, but I'm gonna go someplace else and you're gonna go someplace else. It just doesn't make sense.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: This kinda worked out perfectly for me. I got some good experience. Uh, Michael's gonna write me a great recommendation. And as far as me and Kelly goes, I think it's for the best.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, this is it. [runs up the stairs of CFO's house, with Dwight] This is exactly what Michael Moore does, famous documentarian. He goes up to people with a camera and he's like "Why did you do this? Why did you pollute? You are bad. You're a bad person." It's very dramatic. Although, I can't say I was a big fan of 'Bowling for Columbine', because I thought it was going to be a bowling movie, like 'Kingpin'. And it wasn't. It was something else.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: So, Josh will be running what is now called Dunder-Mifflin ,Northeast, which is all the offices north of Stamford. And Jim, fi you want the job, you'll be his number two.

Quote.Speaker: Josh
Quote.Text: Wow. Uh, sure. Absolutely.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Awesome.

Quote.Speaker: Josh
Quote.Text: Excuse me, Jan, I'm sorry... I'm gonna have to stop you there. I, um, will not be taking the job.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Wha... excuse... why not?

Quote.Speaker: Josh
Quote.Text: As of today, I have accepted a senior managment position at Staples.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Today?

Quote.Speaker: Josh
Quote.Text: [nods]

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: You leveraged your new position with us into another offer?

Quote.Speaker: Josh
Quote.Text: [sighs]

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Damn it, Josh. This whole restructuring thing was based around keeping you. I...

Quote.Speaker: Josh
Quote.Text: I'm sorry, all right? It's done, it's done.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: I'm gonna make some calls.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Say what you will about Michael Scott, but he would never do that.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: So, do you know what you're gonna say when he shows up?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I will improvise. I will speak from the heart.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No. Bad idea. You need an attack plan. Here, I'll be him, you be you. Let's practice.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All right.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [as David Wallace] Dum, dum, dum, dum... coming home from work.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Excuse me, Mr. Wallace? David Wallace?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes? What is the meaning of this?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Can you tell us why you are shutting down Scranton and putting 15 people out of work?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Well, the branch is no longer finicially viable. It's simple dollars and cents.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes, but these are employees, Sir. These are human beings.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Listen, Scott... we're losing money, okay? It's not a charity; it's a business. And it's a dying business.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [no longer talking to Dwight as Wallace] Stop... stop it! Just, okay. He's not going to say any of that.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [as himself] Whoa hey, why not?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Because he'd be intimidated and I, just... let's start again. Just be more scared of me, okay?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Don't touch me this time.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [as David Wallace] Dum, dum, dum, du, doy, du, do... coming home from work...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Excuse me, Mr. Wallace?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [frightened] Uh!

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: So... we are still scrambling here. But uh, it looks like Scranton is going to absorb Stamford.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wow.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: And I know that you just left there a couple of months ago, but we would like to offer you the number two position at that branch.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, it's just I'm not sure if I um... well to be quite honest with you, Jan, I have a few unpleasant memories of Scranton. And um...

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No. No, no. Just um... some personal stuff. And I'm not really ready to revist that, I don't think.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Ah. Well, please think about it. And call me. We will do whatever we can to get you to stay.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Hey guys. Uh, I'm trying to organize a little group lunch for everybody since you know, we're never gonna see each other again.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Where are we going?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I thought maybe DJ's.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: How about Cugino's?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I don't want to go all the way to Dunmore.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: How 'bout Cooper's then?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: No seafood.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: But, I don't want to go to DJ's.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Oh, now all of a sudden you get picky?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Okay, forget it. [walks away]

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Hooters?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ah. [takes a gulp of Gatorade and passes the bottle to Michael] Here, replinish your fluids.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [takes bottle and cleans off cap with his tie]

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: [in Scranton] Where's Michael?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: He's not here. I don't know where he is.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: [looks around, noticing that no one is working] Wha... what's going on here?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: We know the branch is closing; Michael told us.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Ah, god. Okay. You know what everybody? I'm sure there is a better way to do this but I've drive something like 400 miles today and I'm completely exhausted so I'm just gonna tell you. Your branch is not closing; Stamford is closing. Um, for the time being, it seems that all your jobs are safe.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Yes!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yes! [hugs Angela]

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Stanley! [hugs Stanley]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Is it because of Michael? Did he actually do something?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Well, reasons are not important. Would you just call him, please? Wherever he is... and tell him.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Sure, uh, Jan... um, do you know, is anyone coming back to Scranton?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Back?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Coming to Scranton. Is anyone coming to Scranton?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Uh, we don't know. Probably. A few.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [referring to Michael's ringing phone] who is it?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: The office.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Gonna get it?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, not until I have some good news for them. Not until I have some good news.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I guess some new people might be coming from Stamford. Should be fun. New blood.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Is Jim coming back.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: That's, um... I hadn't thought about it, huh.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I just don't want it to be weird, you know? I mean, I took his old job and his old desk.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah, that might be weird. Overall though, we still all have our jobs... so, good news, right?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Oh, yeah, totally.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Ahhhhh! [hugs Ryan] I'm so happy we don't have to break up now, Ryan! [kisses him] This is the best day of my whole l ife!

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: What you gonna do?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I really don't know. How you doing with all this?

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: You know, I'm fine. I'll be better when I know if I have a job.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You'd actually move to Scranton?

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Yeah, if they let me, I think I... I think I would.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: New York City is 45 minutes down the road from here. And you wanna move to Scranton? I dunno. If I were you I'd move to New York?

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Yeah, you know... I might do that. I, who knows? I... I might do that.

Quote.Speaker: Josh
Quote.Text: Hey Andy!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [after screaming and throwing papers around in the kitchen] What's up, Josh?

Quote.Speaker: Josh
Quote.Text: I just want to say thanks. Good luck.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Thanks, man. You, too. Totally.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Anything?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Nothing. [puts down binoculars]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What if this doesn't work? What is the office actually goes under?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Then it was an honor to have worked with you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [pats Dwight and sighs] All right, favorite moments in Dunder-Mifflin history. Go.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: My first day when you hazed me by spraying me with a fire extinguisher.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That was hilarious. The foam ...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Uh,... my first sale, my promotion to assistant regional manager, our basketball game, when you took me to the hospital, and told me that you cared about me.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, right. Okay, that's enough. That's good.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What were your favorite moments?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, hmm, all of them. I loved them all. Every single one.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What about when Jan said the branch was closing?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: God, Dwight!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Well, it doesn't...

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Hey Pam, we're going to Poor Richards. Creed's buying shots.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No thanks, guys.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: All right.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Have fun though.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Cool.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Hey, I hear Jim's coming back.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Really? Where did you hear that?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I was...

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [interupting] Hey Ryan, you coming?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Uh yeah, we'll meet you there.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Awesome. Let's go, Phyllis.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: [to Pam] I'll tell you later.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Crazy day, huh?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Yeah, man! I'm uh... I'm really glad you're still gonna be working here.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah, me too.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Maybe this is good. Finding another job is a pain. There's another annoying boss, another desk, I'd have to learn everything all over again. So, there are reasons to stay.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey, um, I think I am gonna take that job. And Scranton... it's not that bad. So, if they offer you a job there, I think you should take it.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Okay, yeah. Maybe I will.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Yeah, I'm happy he said that. I mean, I don't think he's into me or anything, but, I'm kind of into him. So...there you go.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What are we still doing here? It's over. Let's go home. Get the car.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [picks up his beeping cell phone]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, this was such a stupid idea! This was so stupid. I am such a stupid idiot. I let everybody down. Everybody hates me. I lost everybody's jobs. Nobody likes me anymore!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [on the phone] Oh my God!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What?!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: : Stranford is closed! Michael, we're not closed. Stamford is closed. Stamford is closed.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: We did it? We did it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: We did it!

Quote.Speaker: Michael and Dwight
Quote.Text: We did it! We did it!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Right here! Right here! [pounds his chest against Dwight's]

Quote.Speaker: Michael and Dwight
Quote.Text: Ouu! Ou! Ouu! Ouu!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, baby!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: In your face!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: We did it!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, man.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: How did we do it?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I don't ... have no idea.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't understand.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Well for a minute there, I saw myself selling my house, moving to Costa Rica, learning how to surf. But, Costa Rica will still be there. When I'm 65.
